_header: A shield of red a cross of green
Bibliographic Ghosts: San Marino, CA, Henry Huntington Library HM 26054 [olim Tollemache, Helmingham Hall], f. 3v: not in this MS.

Bod622.First Lines:
A scheld of red a crosse of greneA croune ywriche with thornes
                    kene…
Bod622.Last Lines:
…Who this schild in herte wul takeA mong his enimes þar
                    he noȝt quake
Bod622.Editions:
Wright,  Thomas,  and  James Orchard Halliwell-Phillipps, eds.  
             Reliquiae Antiquae.
         2 vols. London: Smith, 1845: 2.18.
Sisam,  Celia,  and  Kenneth Sisam, eds.  
             The Oxford Book of Medieval English Verse.
         Oxford: Clarendon, 1970: 551.

BLCottCleoDVIII.Transcription:
A scheld of red a crosse of greneA crown I wrythe wiþ
                    þornes keneA spere a sponge wiþ nayles þreA body I
                    bounde to a treeWho so þis scheld in hert wyl takeAmong hys
                    enemyes þahre he not quake

NLS18721.First Lines:
A scheld of red a cros of greneA corune of þornes wonden
                    kene…
NLS18721.Last Lines:
…Wo so þis seld to him takeffor is forman þar him
                    nouth quake
NLS18721.Editions:
Wilson,  Edward. 
             A Descriptive Index of the English Lyrics in John of Grimestone’s
                Preaching Book.
Medium Ævum Monographs
         n.s. 2. Oxford, 1973: 38.
